Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: between black on lip and below handle zone, black-figure decoration frieze: siren to right with outspread wings confronting a deer (of siren, one wing and lower body missing; added red on wing and body; of deer head, neck with red and one foreleg remain.
Curator's comments: For the siren, compare Athens, Agora P 4630 in Agora XXIII, pl. 110, no. 1690 and Munich 2229 in CVA Munich 11, pl. 44, no. 4-5 and Vierneisel, K. and Kaeser, B., Kunst der Schale. Kultur des Trinkens. Munich 1990, 31, no. 2.14. For the deer, compare the band cup, Munich 2192 in CVA Munich 11, pl. 17, no. 6-8 and Vierneisel and Kaeser 1990, 103, no. 12.25, dated 550-530 BC.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0521) (Phase 1)
